article.headline: Rider 65, Manhattan 64
article.story: NEW YORK -- Mike Ringgold's tip-in with 6.2 seconds sealed Rider's late comeback, propelling the Broncs to a 65-64 win over Manhattan on Monday night. Trailing 60-56, Rider outscored Manhattan 9-4 over the final 4:16 of the game, including a basket by Justin Robinson with 1:06 left that cut the Manhattan lead to 64-63. That set up Ringgold's game-winner. Robinson led Rider (9-7, 2-2 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) with 17 points. Novar Gadson tallied a double-double, scoring 14 points and pulling down 13 rebounds. Ryan Thompson added 12 points for the Broncs. Trailing 49-37, Rider went on a 17-4 run to take a 54-53 lead with 8:37 left to play. It was Rider's first lead since 4-2. The Broncs made 7 of 10 3-pointers in the second half and were 8-for-15 for the game. Rico Pickett scored 25 points to lead the Jaspers (6-8, 1-3).

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
